docs.snippet: When Real Madrid paid around 30 million euros (£25 million) to buy Isco from Malaga in the close season it seemed the talented playmaker was poised to become a fixture for club and country.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Real Madrid paid around 30 million euros (£25 million) to buy Isco from Malaga in the close season it seemed the talented playmaker was poised to become a fixture for club and country.

headline.main: No Major Role for 'Golden Boy' Isco at Real Madrid
headline.print_headline: No Major Role for 'Golden Boy' Isco at Real Madrid

docs.snippet: Former England captain John Terry will not be recalled for the international friendly matches leading up to this year's World Cup finals in Brazil, manager Roy Hodgson said on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former England captain John Terry will not be recalled for the international friendly matches leading up to this year's World Cup finals in Brazil, manager Roy Hodgson said on Wednesday.

headline.main: No Way Back for Terry, Says England Manager
headline.print_headline: No Way Back for Terry, Says England Manager

docs.snippet: The United States and Europe need a new strategy in the war on drugs and should look at alternatives such as the regulated sale of marijuana, says Uruguayan President Jose Mujica, whose country recently legalized the production and sale of cannabis.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States and Europe need a new strategy in the war on drugs and should look at alternatives such as the regulated sale of marijuana, says Uruguayan President Jose Mujica, whose country recently legalized the production and sale of cannabis.

headline.main: Drug Policy Must Change in U.S., Europe - Uruguay President
headline.print_headline: Drug Policy Must Change in U.S., Europe - Uruguay President

docs.snippet: Leftist lawmakers on Thursday proposed allowing the sale of marijuana within Mexico City, seeking to join Uruguay and the U.S. states of Washington and Colorado in creating legal markets for the drug.
docs.lead_paragraph: Leftist lawmakers on Thursday proposed allowing the sale of marijuana within Mexico City, seeking to join Uruguay and the U.S. states of Washington and Colorado in creating legal markets for the drug.

headline.main: Mexico City Mulls Legalizing Sale of Marijuana
headline.print_headline: Mexico City Mulls Legalizing Sale of Marijuana

docs.snippet: In a former colonial mansion in Jamaica, politicians huddle to discuss trying to ease marijuana laws in the land of the late reggae musician and cannabis evangelist Bob Marley. In Morocco, one of the world's top producers of the concentrated pot...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a former colonial mansion in Jamaica, politicians huddle to discuss trying to ease marijuana laws in the land of the late reggae musician and cannabis evangelist Bob Marley. In Morocco, one of the world's top producers of the concentrated pot known as hashish, two leading political parties want to legalize its cultivation, at least for medical and industrial use.

headline.main: US Drug Policy Fuels Push for Legal Pot Worldwide
headline.print_headline: US Drug Policy Fuels Push for Legal Pot Worldwide

docs.snippet: The marijuana legalization experiments underway in Washington state, Colorado and Uruguay have prompted or accelerated discussion about changing pot laws in many nations, and activists say momentum is building in advance of a special United Nations...
docs.lead_paragraph: The marijuana legalization experiments underway in Washington state, Colorado and Uruguay have prompted or accelerated discussion about changing pot laws in many nations, and activists say momentum is building in advance of a special United Nations convention on drugs scheduled for 2016. Here's a look at how some countries are rethinking their approach to marijuana.

headline.main: Countries Rethink Pot Laws in Wake of US, Uruguay
headline.print_headline: Countries Rethink Pot Laws in Wake of US, Uruguay

docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson may display a calm and patient demeanor but he also has a nasty side, according to his assistant Ray Lewington.
docs.lead_paragraph: England manager Roy Hodgson may display a calm and patient demeanor but he also has a nasty side, according to his assistant Ray Lewington.

headline.main: England Boss Hodgson Has Nasty Side, Says Assistant
headline.print_headline: England Boss Hodgson Has Nasty Side, Says Assistant

docs.snippet: With a growing economy, a reduced debt and an enviable rainy-day fund, Bolivia has become a nation whose fiscal policy is praised by international financial institutions.
docs.lead_paragraph: With a growing economy, a reduced debt and an enviable rainy-day fund, Bolivia has become a nation whose fiscal policy is praised by international financial institutions.
docs.abstract: Bolivia, once known for financial instability, has begun seeing modest economic gains, with its economy growing 6.5 percent in 2013; country has balanced its budget, slashed its debt and accumulated foreign currency reserves of $14 billion, thanks in large part to prudent economic policies of President Evo Morales.

headline.main: Turnabout in Bolivia as Economy Rises From Instability
headline.print_headline: Turnabout in Bolivia as Economy Rises From Instability

docs.snippet: For Brazilians, not winning the World Cup would be bad enough.
docs.lead_paragraph: For Brazilians, not winning the World Cup would be bad enough.

headline.main: Brazil's Worst Nightmare: Argentina Wins World Cup
headline.print_headline: Brazil's Worst Nightmare: Argentina Wins World Cup

docs.snippet: Left-wing Mexican senators on Tuesday presented an initiative to legalize medical marijuana, saying a new approach was needed to speed up drug liberalization and help end a cycle of cartel violence that has killed tens of thousands.
docs.lead_paragraph: Left-wing Mexican senators on Tuesday presented an initiative to legalize medical marijuana, saying a new approach was needed to speed up drug liberalization and help end a cycle of cartel violence that has killed tens of thousands.

headline.main: Leftist Mexican Lawmakers Present Medical Marijuana Bill
